content.description: Start down in the grotto-cave on a good hueco hold. Move right to the arÃªte, and traverse up around the corner using pockets. Finish out on the face with a bad landing.
content.protection: To properly protect would be a number of pads as the problem traverses quite a bit. The top-out needs some spotters.
content.location: Enter through the leaning blocks, and it is in the grotto. The climb is physically on the Titanic Boulder.

content.description:
As described originally in

Colorado Bouldering 2

: "Chubby yet Appealing"...we will leave that decision up to you.

Start in a scoop face on rough slopers. Traverse left into the right-leaning arete and head-up on cobbles.

Apparently it is V7 if you start way right.
content.protection: The top-out is high. Before that will need spotters.
content.location: On the north-side of the Titanic Boulder sits a few problems set away from the other sections on this boulder.

content.description: This is a weird, ass-dragging problem. Start on a giant horn and then move towards the arete. There is a long reach to the ending holds over the arete.
content.protection: Pads, it is not too high.
content.location: This is in the Corridor area on the Titanic Boulder.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
